cause.description:
Many educational institutions in the United States are considering cutting Shakespeare from their curriculums. As the works of the Bard are some of the most important works in the English language, embracing universal themes and relevant social commentary poignant in today's world, it is imperative that the Complete Works remain part of the educational lives of future generations. Keeping his works on stage and in the classroom is a must. The Empty Space Theatre in Bakersfield, CA is one of many theatres in the nation bringing Shakespeare alive to those who may not get the chance to see his works outside of a metropolitan area. Your contributions to this non-profit, donation only theatre will serve to keep Shakespeare and other works alive and on the stage for all to see.
1. Shakespeare's works are masterpieces on the genius level.
2. They are universal.
3. An education featuring his works can only serve the student in other aspects of his/her life.
cause.mission: Keep the analysis, performance, and study of Shakespeare's works accessible to students of all levels.
cause.name: Keep Shakespeare Accessible
